Thanks for sharing your week with me, it's time to pass the baton along and for me to log out.

urls.title: Leeds Lit Fest
urls.description: Leeds Lit Fest 2023 is back! Join us from Saturday 25 Feb - Sunday 5 March. Returning for its fifth year, the city’s award-winning festival of words and thought will take place across a diverse range of the city’s spaces and aims to bring together, and help develop, the city’s literary scene, with writers, poets and performers from the UK and beyond. This year’s festival will tie in with Leeds 2023, the citywide celebration of culture and will interweave themes of untold stories, radical acts, playful adventures and future generations The festival which is organised by a number of cultural organisations in the city, will engage audiences in over 50 events aimed to appeal not just to lovers of books and the written word but also to appeal to audiences who would never normally consider going to a literature festival. This eclectic approach to the programme will see comedy, cabaret, a literature quiz, film screening, art exhibition, theatre performance, a literature walk and creative work

tweets.text:
Animals, adventures & all kinds of fun 🐯 🚀 🐿️ 

As ever, Leeds Libraries have delivered a great selection of children’s events. Places are free, book soon as they fill quickly

Check out the site for info / pass on to parents / schools🎈 

https://t.co/nWcdwuZaZf 

#edutwitter https://t.co/QNQZo0Vj6Y

They've been celebrating #Christmas for centuries @TempleNewsam, so you just know they're always going to smash it with the festive decs!🎄Having said that, think you'll all agree they've properly outdone themselves this year!😍🤌 https://t.co/pIj4PnOv8j

As things could be tricky this year 

If you could use a book as a gift, just DM us, no questions asked, discrete, you can pop in

Likewise if you’ll be on your own and could do with one 📚 

Lots of nice northern publishers too.

#inittogether #publishing #PayItForward https://t.co/RRLGynxkAs

urls.title: Leeds Lit Fest
urls.description: Leeds Lit Fest 2023 is back! Join us from Saturday 25 Feb - Sunday 5 March. Returning for its fifth year, the city’s award-winning festival of words and thought will take place across a diverse range of the city’s spaces and aims to bring together, and help develop, the city’s literary scene, with writers, poets and performers from the UK and beyond. This year’s festival will tie in with Leeds 2023, the citywide celebration of culture and will interweave themes of untold stories, radical acts, playful adventures and future generations The festival which is organised by a number of cultural organisations in the city, will engage audiences in over 50 events aimed to appeal not just to lovers of books and the written word but also to appeal to audiences who would never normally consider going to a literature festival. This eclectic approach to the programme will see comedy, cabaret, a literature quiz, film screening, art exhibition, theatre performance, a literature walk and creative work

urls.title: Football Clichés - Carriageworks Theatre
urls.description: Hyde Park Book Club & The Square Ball present Football Clichés  What the are unwritten rules of co-commentary? Who are the most boo-able team in the country? What’s the most “assistant referee” name possible? What are the traditional contents of a player’s proverbial “locker”? What’s the best red-card brandishing technique? And what specific footballing situations […]

tweets.text:
After a sold out Uk & Ireland tour, Football Clichés are coming to Leeds, with special guests, Leeds own @TheSquareBall & @PhilHay_ ⚽️ 

Join us for a deep dive into the subconscious code of the world's most talked-about and written-about sport.

Tkts: https://t.co/FQGIdg1UNd https://t.co/l7LU5DGJY6
Board games night at The Beck and Call Meanwood https://t.co/lfpQLhUyxI

urls.title: Get rid of unwanted items
urls.description: The quickest and most environmentally friendly way to get rid of your unwanted items is to donate to charity or use an organisation that will take the items.

urls.title: Free and low-cost activities for people in Leeds
urls.description: With the cost of living going up, and Christmas almost here, many residents and families in Leeds will be searching for fun things to do and days out that won’t break the bank. Each week, we’ll be highlighting some of the best things to do in the city that won’t cost too much. You can also visit www.leedsinspired.co.uk for more ideas and inspiration.

tweets.text: Some absolute #Christmas crackers feature on our list of free and low-cost things to do in #Leeds this week! 🎄🎅 If you're on the lookout for some festive fun that won't break the bank, we've got you covered #costofliving https://t.co/RnICNb23zR https://t.co/72jrteVWz3

@PeopleofLeeds Rudys for pizza, hands down. A quick bite its got to be rola wala in trinity. Steak its gaucho. Vegan it's bundobust. Zaap thai, for thai obvs. Archies jn trinity for a chicken burger. Meat Liquor is good for a dirty hippy burger but Almost Famous do some crazy ones too

urls.title: The Rough Guide to the best travel destinations in 2023
urls.description: Wondering where’s best to visit in 2023? Read on to discover Rough Guides’ best travel destinations in 2023, as recommended by Rough Guides’ readers, editors and local experts.

tweets.text: Our wonderful city of Leeds has come in at no. 9 in @RoughGuides list of best destinations in the world to visit in 2023. Best for 'gourmands and gallery lovers and theatre fans' #VisitLeeds #Leeds2023 https://t.co/1VnX19ZOqK https://t.co/V2b8nUNxBn

urls.title: LGBT+ Wellbeing & Social Cafe
urls.description: After nearly 6 years as the Coffee & Cake Café we have a new home and a new brand for our monthly social evening. From August 2022 we are now the LGBT+ Wellbeing & Social Café, still serving up free coffee and cake (with support from Leeds City Council LGBT+ Hub & www.smiffys.com)

urls.title: Jobs – Wharf Chambers
urls.description: Wharf Chambers is looking for bar staff to work a 6 months contract, with a possibility of extending. Hours: minimum of 10 hrs a week with access to more hours if desired (you will be expected to mainly work evenings and club nights). Pay rate: £ 11.25/h before midnight and £ 15.25/h after midnight. Paid

Pay is £11.25/hr before midnight and £15.25/hr after midnight. 

Read the full job description and how to apply: https://t.co/yu6P4yV9lC https://t.co/AsQ4w95B7e
@PeopleofLeeds Hey, I think you meant to say Teesside! #TeessidenotTeeside
@PeopleofLeeds I don’t normally watch reality stuff  but have you seen “Traitors”?
@PeopleofLeeds @J_Warrington Brill - any idea what time Josh is on approx?
@PeopleofLeeds Working for those that order through Amazon, absolutely pain tbh x otherwise a quiet afternoon. Hope you had a fab retro games evening x

@PeopleofLeeds Went to the library with 9yo & played the piano. Took delivery of The Tree, which now won't fit in its stand. So tomorrow's exciting event will involve sawing the trunk into a slimmer shape and hopefully not sawing off any digits.
@PeopleofLeeds Yes! This afternoon was all about understanding more about the light fittings in my home. #ExcitingLighting
@PeopleofLeeds I was working there on Light night and a big group of kids were throwing stones at it 🫣

It's Party Time for #ExploreYourArchive week! 🥳

Here's one of the most joyful images in our archive, a proper knees up with the one-and-only Danny La Rue in the final broadcast of the BBC's The Good Old Days, aired 24 December 1983.

📸 @BBCArchive 
#EYAParty @explorearchives https://t.co/3mcRWry07K

@PeopleofLeeds Gang of 4? Good to see Mekons. There's some of those I'd have left off though!

@PeopleofLeeds @_Estabulo_ HB to you 🎉
